history.content: There's no way to do this automatically as far as I know. The only way I know this can be done is if both of you pester either enrollment or professors/TAs of both classes to manually do it. For instance you tell your 162 professor/TA to add your friend  after you drop and your friend tell their 188 professor/TA to add you after they drop.

There's no way to do this automatically as far as I know. The only way I know this is possible is if both of you pester either enrollment or professors/TAs of both classes to manually do it. For instance you tell your 162 professor/TA to add your friend  after you drop and your friend tell their 188 professor/TA to add you after they drop.

The professor's don't manage enrollment. Their permission may or may not be required. The person who could make this happen can be reached at cs-enrollments@cs.berkeley.edu

That being said, no student owns their spot in the class such that they have rights to give it to another. The student first on the waitlist who indicated a desire to take the class they are waitlisted has a stronger claim.

Dear EECS Community,

I am an EECS major who is currently enrolled in CS 162. However, since 162 relies on 61C (which i am currently taking), my experience with 162 has not been pleasant so far.

I was just wondering if it is "possible", according COE guidelines, to swap my position with another student who happens to be enrolled in CS 188 and who wants to enroll in 162 and drop 188.

Any advice will be appreciated!
history.subject: Swap positions from CS 162 to CS 188 with another student
